application

Class CopyController

  • java.lang.Object
    • application.CopyController

  • public class CopyController
extends java.lang.Object
    The gui that appears when a resource is clicked, shows the information about a resource and allows the user to request a copy if there is a free copy available.
    Author:
    Joe Wright

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void changeScene(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event, java.lang.String sceneFXML)
      Sets new scene on stage within program using fxml file provided.
      private void checkIfBorrowed()
      This checks if the current user is currently borrowing the resource, if they have then it will disable the request copy button.
      void initialize()
      An initialize method that checks the user if its a staff, and loads the resource image and information when started.
      private void loadResourceImage()
      Loads resource image from Resource class, so that they can be displayed within the UI.
      private void loadResourceInformation()
      Loads resource information from Screen Manager class, so that it can be displayed within the UI.
      void requestCopy(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
      When the button is clicked, it will send a request to a librarian and they can either decline or accept said request.
      private void setupStaffButtons()
      These are only buttons that appear when the user is a staff, these buttons allow the librarian to manage the resources.

    • Method Detail

      • changeScene

        public void changeScene(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event,
                        java.lang.String sceneFXML)
        Sets new scene on stage within program using fxml file provided.
        Parameters:
        sceneFXML - The scene location.
        event - The event.

      • loadResourceInformation

        private void loadResourceInformation()
        Loads resource information from Screen Manager class, so that it can be displayed within the UI. Shows different information depending on the resource.

      • loadResourceImage

        private void loadResourceImage()
        Loads resource image from Resource class, so that they can be displayed within the UI.

      • requestCopy

        public void requestCopy(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
        When the button is clicked, it will send a request to a librarian and they can either decline or accept said request.
        Parameters:
        event - button being pressed.

      • checkIfBorrowed

        private void checkIfBorrowed()
        This checks if the current user is currently borrowing the resource, if they have then it will disable the request copy button.

      • setupStaffButtons

        private void setupStaffButtons()
        These are only buttons that appear when the user is a staff, these buttons allow the librarian to manage the resources.

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        An initialize method that checks the user if its a staff, and loads the resource image and information when started.
